title: Grades 9-12: American Sign Language, Level IV
subject: Languages Other Than English (2014-)

document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Languages Other Than English

2348077F840F4264B22E764A2612EE71.description: show evidence of becoming a lifelong learner by using ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level for personal enrichment and career development.

2545E1B5E30E4729B27FCDEACECDAC10.description: use technology to communicate with the Deaf/ASL community; and

F478E434D73C44CD83C645784E0846F1.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level in or out of the school setting through involvement in cultural activities such as attending Deaf events;

90EFDC7326AE45678E0CF0610F1F2AB4.description: Communities. The student participates in the Deaf/ASL community by using ASL. The student is expected to:

8EBD3A0DAB234AB784D433C5D845308A.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of how one language and culture can influence another.

D7B8C04ABB894909A341E7AC6A6EF3C8.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of culture through comparisons of the student's own culture and the American Deaf culture; and

3388988F06D14E609242C419D40384E8.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to demonstrate an understanding of the nature of language through comparisons of the student's own language and ASL;

08DF1F8954F640B08D0AE40A6FBC5F49.description: Comparisons. The student expands insight into the nature of language and culture by comparing the student's own language and culture to ASL and American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

51DA526E3CFE45DFB869514DDE5AFC2B.description: apply ASL at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level to obtain, reinforce, or expand knowledge of other subject areas.

15CB2CBE28584A5A8C60B567B83D79F8.description: use resources and digital technology to gain access to extensive information on ASL and Deaf culture; and

3731DCE9CD8F4FC8872D8EE1EE16B316.description: Connections. The student uses ASL to make connections with other subject areas and to acquire information. The student is expected to:

167FCF1A7F124964AAD67A325837E1E7.description: demonstrate an in-depth understanding of Deaf history and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture.

52EC2FD6F2E54B98933DB60EA0028CCF.description: apply ASL to show evidence of appreciation of the contributions to arts and sciences by the Deaf and how they are applied to the perspectives of American Deaf culture; and

E3AA815658FC4FEFB46ADA0576B5EBA1.description: apply ASL to show evidence of appreciation of ASL literature created by the Deaf and how it applies to the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

9EEF9F5BD5B84783A1B9C23E70884F40.description: apply ASL to recognize and use Deaf cultural norms to demonstrate an understanding of the perspectives of American Deaf culture;

D57537C7054B45BDBBFCD24F8572B484.description: Cultures. The student gains knowledge and understanding of American Deaf culture. The student is expected to:

DF233E9B69574AD6BF0506A952369BF9.description: create and express ASL literature, including handshape stories, that follows traditional cultural features.

7921B34006E1430EB0F4D6D8D591CF1E.description: demonstrate appropriate usage of ASL phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and pragmatics at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level; and

39A4C22D11E34392AA7C7E85398A39DA.description: convey information in ASL using concepts, classifiers, phrases, and sentences to others without voice at the intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level;

87CE6F89C78346F895632DFB3A7805B6.description: demonstrate an understanding of ASL such as stories, commands, and instructions when dealing with familiar and unfamiliar topics;

98A5F6FE41A94F4BA4F69D53923B9AC4.description: engage in a variety of ASL exchanges of learned material to socialize and to provide and obtain information at an intermediate-to-advanced proficiency level;

DB09617527B0479EAAC4C9CB65E46934.description: Communication. The student communicates in ASL using expressive and receptive communication skills without voice. The student is expected to:
